skill.name: backend-orchestrator
skill.description: Coordinates backend development tasks (APIs, services, databases). Use when implementing REST APIs, business logic, data models, or service integrations. Applies backend-standard.md for quality gates.
skill.summary: Coordinates backend development tasks (APIs, services, databases). Use when implementing REST APIs, ...
skill.author: Brownbull

security_audit.summary: This skill contains only documentation and orchestration instructions. SKILL.md is a pure markdown file with no executable code. The static scanner flagged markdown code blocks and JSON metadata as dangerous patterns, but these are documentation examples and field names, not actual security vulnerabilities. The skill teaches security best practices including encryption, input validation, and SQL injection prevention.

content.value_statement: Managing backend development across APIs, databases, and services requires coordination. This skill orchestrates all backend tasks while enforcing quality standards and best practices.
actual_capabilities: Design and manage REST API endpoints with versioning and authentication
Coordinate database schema design, migrations, and query optimization
Implement service layer patterns with third-party integrations
Apply backend quality standards to all development tasks
Monitor task execution and validate results against security checks
Communicate with frontend and data orchestrators for integration
limitations: Does not execute code or modify running systems directly
Requires Claude Code environment to be installed and configured
Does not directly access databases or deploy applications
Coordinates other skills but does not replace database or API skills

use_cases.title: Coordinate API and Database Work
use_cases.description: Manage backend tasks across multiple services while maintaining code quality and consistency.

use_cases.title: Enforce Backend Standards
use_cases.description: Apply standardized patterns for API design, database operations, and security requirements.

use_cases.title: Orchestrate Service Integrations
use_cases.description: Coordinate complex backend workflows including third-party services and data pipelines.

prompt_templates.title: Create New API
prompt_templates.prompt: Use backend-orchestrator to create a new REST API endpoint for [resource]. Include proper versioning, authentication, and validation.

prompt_templates.title: Database Migration
prompt_templates.prompt: Use backend-orchestrator to design a database migration for [table]. Include rollback plan and index optimization.

prompt_templates.title: Service Integration
prompt_templates.prompt: Use backend-orchestrator to integrate [service] with our backend. Implement error handling and circuit breaker pattern.

prompt_templates.title: Backend Code Review
prompt_templates.prompt: Use backend-orchestrator to review the backend code at [path]. Check for security, performance, and quality standard compliance.

output_examples.input: Use backend-orchestrator to create a user authentication API endpoint
output: Added input validation and rate limiting
Database query optimized with index on email
Security checks: SQL injection prevention, XSS protection
Test coverage: 85% unit tests, 90% integration tests

output_examples.input: Use backend-orchestrator to design a database migration for the orders table
output: Designed migration to add order_status and customer_id columns
Created index on customer_id for faster lookups
Added foreign key constraint to customers table

output_examples.input: Use backend-orchestrator to integrate a payment gateway service
output: Implemented service wrapper for payment provider API
Added circuit breaker pattern for resilience
Created webhook handler for payment notifications
Configured retry logic with exponential backoff
Added unit tests covering success and failure scenarios

best_practices: Always validate input before database operations to prevent injection attacks
Use parameterized queries instead of string concatenation for database access
Implement proper error handling with consistent response formats across all endpoints
anti_patterns: Hardcoding configuration or secrets directly in source code files
Putting business logic directly in API controllers instead of service layer
Skipping database migrations rollback testing before deployment

faq.question: What databases does this skill support?
faq.answer: The skill works with any database through orchestration patterns. Actual database operations depend on installed database skills.

faq.question: Does this skill modify my production database?
faq.answer: No. The skill only coordinates tasks and validates standards. It does not directly access or modify databases.

faq.question: How does this integrate with frontend development?
faq.answer: The skill communicates with frontend orchestrator to agree on API contracts, request formats, and error standards.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill is purely prompt-based with no executable code. It cannot access or exfiltrate any data.

faq.question: Why is my API response time slow?
faq.answer: Check database queries for missing indexes. The skill enforces less than 200ms response time targets. Review query optimization guidelines.

faq.question: How is this different from other backend tools?
faq.answer: This is an orchestration layer that coordinates other backend skills while enforcing quality standards and patterns.
